segments.en: Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yamahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto vihareyyan”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”

segments.pli: “Yo kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
segments.en: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.
And what is liable to cease?

segments.pli: Rūpaṃ kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
segments.en: Form is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

segments.pli: vedanā nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
saññā nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
saṅkhārā nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
viññāṇaṃ nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo … pe …
segments.en: Consciousness is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.

segments.pli: yo kho, rādha, nirodhadhammo; tatra te chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.
segments.en: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.”

suttaplex.blurb: Rādha asks the Buddha for a teaching before going on retreat, and the Buddha says that he should abandon desire, explaining what is liable to cease in terms of the five aggregates.
